intro: Sesamoides spathulifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaf sesamoid, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its broad, ovate leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, thriving in moist, acidic soils. Its foliage is often densely arranged, and the flowers bloom in clusters, adding ornamental value to wetland landscapes. Sesamoides spathulifolia is an important species for ecological studies due to its role in wetland ecosystems.
